Node.definition: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= to act forcibly on something, ► so as to cause it to become waste and/or desolate

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

Node.gloss: to devastate|to make desolate|to lay waste
Node.definition: = to cause something to be totally destroyed
= causative action by which deities change the shape of an object ► with the purpose of destroying it
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= man who is in a position of authority over another person or object as a legal owner, employer, husband, or sovereign; or a person or deity who is referred to as such in a conversation or prayer
= woman who is in a position of authority over another person as a legal owner, employer, or sovereign

Node.gloss: to acquire|to obtain|to purchase|to buy|to reclaim
Node.definition: = action by which humans acquire an animate or inanimate object ◄ by means of a financial transaction or in another way
= causative action by which humans hand over objects or privileges in their possession in exchange for goods or money
= to give money or other valuables to someone else, which can be used for some time but is to be returned later, whether with interest or not; ≈ often associated with wealth and acts of charity
= to receive money or other valuables from someone else, which can be used for some time but is to be returned later, whether with interest or not; ≈ often associated with poverty
= action with which a person gives money or something of value to another person with the expectation that it will be paid back or returned
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
= action with which a person gives money or something of value to another person with the expectation that it will be paid back or returned
= to act forcibly on something, ► so as to cause it to become waste and/or desolate
= to act forcibly on something, ► so as to cause it to become waste and/or desolate

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= action by which someone takes all sorts of goods (including people and animals) by force from an enemy in war
= action by which someone takes all sorts of goods (including people and animals) by force from an enemy in war
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= process by which plants and their products become devoid of moisture, and therefore lose color and bend over ◄ as if in mourning, ► which may ultimately result in death if circumstances do not change; ≈ associated with drought and destruction, often as punishment from God

= process by which plants and their products become devoid of moisture, and therefore lose color and bend over ► which may ultimately result in death if circumstances do not change; ≈ associated with drought and destruction, often as punishment from God

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= state of being unable to function as can be expected; ◄ as a result of destruction, a drought, or God's direct intervention; ► results include weakness, sadness, shame, death, and disintegration, depending on the situation

= process by which plants and their products become devoid of moisture, and therefore lose color and bend over ► which may ultimately result in death if circumstances do not change; ≈ associated with drought and destruction, often as punishment from God
primarily used in poetry: = the earth as opposed to the sky, with special focus on the area that is inhabited by humans

= state of being unable to function as can be expected; ◄ as a result of destruction, a drought, or God's direct intervention; ► results include weakness, sadness, shame, death, and disintegration, depending on the situation

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= process by which land becomes impure as a result of the morally and ethically unacceptable things that happen there, ► and therefore unfit for God to associate with
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior
= action by which humans purposely do not perform an event that they were bound by law to perform
= a pattern of behavior required by somebody in authority
= a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

= action by which the name of a deity is invoked and asked to punish a wrong doer; ◄ contexts in which this may happen include: (1) covenants and agreements, where the deity is asked to punish those who do not obey the terms of the agreement, (2) cases where a supposedly wrongful act has been committed, but where there is not enough certainty about the identity of the person who is responsible, and (3) in order to prevent people from committing a wrongful action, knowing that the deity's punishment will be upon them if they do so
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

Node.gloss: to bear one's guilt|to be punished
Node.definition: = to bear the consequences for an unlawful deed for which one is held responsible
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= process by which humans gradually disappear from the face of the earth ◄ as if burnt away by fire
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality
= state in which objects are relatively few in number

= process by which plants and their products become devoid of moisture, and therefore lose color and bend over ◄ as if in mourning, ► which may ultimately result in death if circumstances do not change; ≈ associated with drought and destruction, often as punishment from God

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of newly harvested grapes and possibly still at the beginning of the fermentation process; ► used as beverage and for sacrifice; ≈ represents the entire range of agricultural products in Israel, together with grain and oil; associated with joy and well being, and only once with drunkenness and foolishness

= state of being unable to function as can be expected; ◄ as a result of destruction, a drought, or God's direct intervention; ► results include weakness, sadness, shame, death, and disintegration, depending on the situation

= a creeping plant that develops a woody stem when it matures; it grows along the ground until it finds a tree or other object to climb, using tendrils (שָׂרִיג) ◄ vitis vinifera; ► it bears clusters (אֶשְׁכֹּל) of grapes (עֲנָב) that are sweet and juicy and can be made into wine (יַיִן) ≈ a symbol of blessing, prosperity, and happiness
= action by which humans or animals make a deep inarticulate sound ◄ caused by pain, grief, or severe suffering
= state in which humans feel and show great joy
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

= musical instrument, consisting of a membrane, usually of animal skin, which was stretched over a shallow circular, triangular, or square frame; ► it was struck sharply with one or two hands, depending on where it was situated; it could be held in one hand, under the arm, or against the chest and struck with the other hand, or it could be held on the knees or the ground and struck with one or two hands; the fingers of one hand could be used to tighten or loosen the tension on the membrane as it was struck
= process by which events stop happening
= process by which humans produce loud sounds, either as individuals or groups, in order to give expression to aggression, revelry, or excessive pride

= musical instrument consisting of a sound box ◄ made of wood, out of the ends or sides of which projected two arms; the arms supported a crosspiece; strings descended from the crosspiece over the sound box and the number of strings could vary; ► often used to accompany singing

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex

= alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of dates through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= location that is devoid of any life and without any structure or order
= causative action by which humans close the entrance(s) to a location, supposedly by shutting its doors (דֶּלֶת)

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= process of crying out loud ◄ caused either by joy or by grief ► in order to give vent to one's feelings

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex
= area outside of living quarters; ► used as thoroughfare

Node.gloss: to grow dark, to fade > to end
Node.definition: literally: to grow dark, become evening; hence = process by which an event comes to an end ◄ as the day comes to an end when daylight fades
= state in which humans feel and show great joy
= action by which a group of people leave their country because they are forced to settle somewhere else for an indefinite amount of time

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= state in which buildings and infrastructure have been destroyed
= causative action by which humans use excessive power to break an object into little pieces

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

Node.gloss: beating (a tree to harvest its fruits)
Node.definition: = action by which humans insert a stick between the branches of an olive tree and thrash it back and forth, shaking the branches until most or all the olives drop off

= tree reaching up to 10 m. high, but usually pruned to around 5 m.; its leaves are grayish green above, and whitish underneath; its fruit is about 2 cm. long and a bit more than 1 cm. thick with a hard stone inside and a soft skin that covers the oily flesh; ► its fruit is used for food and oil for cooking, for lamps, for rubbing on the body, for medicine, and for anointing; ≈ regarded as beautiful and associated with well being
= crops that are left on the field after the harvest, ≈ sometimes used figuratively to denote the aftermath of an event
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

Node.gloss: to be finished|to be completed|to come to an end|to be past
Node.definition: = process by which an activity comes to full completion
= pattern of actions by which humans harvest the grapes that have matured and are ready for picking
literally: to lift up (one's) voice = action by which humans speak with a loud voice
= state in which humans or deities have an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans shout ◄ for joy or because of grief ► to give vent to their feelings
literally: the sea; = a cardinal direction pointing towards the west, ◄ which, in Israel, is the direction towards the Mediterranean Sea
= area located in the direction where the sun comes up
= action by which humans, deities, or animals treat other humans, deities, times, or objects with honor and respect
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= area located near the sea and/or the people living there; ≈ associated with commerce, remoteness, paganism, but also called on to acknowledge YHWH
literally: the sea; hence: = a large body of salt water located between Europe and Africa, west of Canaan/Israel
literally: name; hence: = the core of one's identity, which reflect the essence of one's being
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= part where converging sides or edges of an object meet; ≈ sometimes associated with the far side of an object

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= action by which one expresses utters words at a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not
= state in which someone or something is worthy of honor and respect ◄ because of beauty, power, or fame
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
exclamation expressing grief and dismay

Node.gloss: to act unfaithfully|to be treacherous|to deal treacherously|to break faith|to betray
Node.definition: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds

Node.gloss: to act unfaithfully|to be treacherous|to deal treacherously|to break faith|to betray
Node.definition: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds
= pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deed

Node.gloss: to act unfaithfully|to be treacherous|to deal treacherously|to break faith|to betray
Node.definition: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds

Node.gloss: to act unfaithfully|to be treacherous|to deal treacherously|to break faith|to betray
Node.definition: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds
= process by which someone experiences extreme fear, ► which may be accompanied by visible symptoms such as trembling
= contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= process by which someone experiences extreme fear, ► which may be accompanied by visible symptoms such as trembling
= process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

Node.gloss: to go up|to climb up|to mount
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals or objects go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot, carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle
= action by which humans or animals take control of (other) humans, animals, towns or land, usually with violence
= contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control
= opening in a wall

= causative action by which humans or deities allow others entrance, passage, or access (in)to a building, construction, or area ◄ by withdrawing a gate, door, window, lid, covering, or other boundary; ≈ sometimes associated with freedom, sometimes with being exposed, vulnerable
= the bottom part of a construction, which bears everything built on top of it; sometimes used in a somewhat figurative sense to denote the foundations of heaven and earth

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
read רֹעַ (רעע)

Node.gloss: to be broken|to be crushed|to be ruined
Node.definition: = process by which objects are fractured or smashed

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= state in which an object is not firmly fixed to the surface on which it stands so that it can move or slip; to waver
= state in which an object is not firmly fixed to the surface on which it stands so that it can move or slip; to waver

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= state in which humans are intoxicated ◄ as a result of having had too much alcohol
= process by which objects shake or move back and forth ◄ because of being unstable or when agitated by an outside force

Node.gloss: to be heavy|to be serious|to be grievous|to be burdensome|to be strong
Node.definition: = state in which an event is weighing heavily on the mind of those undergoing it
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
= process by which humans or animals lose their balance while walking or standing and end up flat on the ground; ≈ associated with failure and loss of face
= process by which an action is repeated or continued

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= action by which deities or humans inflict a penalty on other deities, humans, animals, or objects, usually as retribution for an offence
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: host of YHWH or host of heaven; hence: = heavenly beings surrounding God's throne, praising him and carrying out his will on earth
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again

= the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again
= to bring together people, animals, plants, and/or other things from different places for a common purpose
= people brought together from different places for a common purpose
usually used as collective: = person who is locked up in a prison or other location where one does not have the freedom to act and go at will
= underground location where people are confined, usually as punishment for an alleged crime

Node.gloss: to shut in|to shut up|to imprison
Node.definition: = action of restricting or containing a person or an object to a specific space
= place where criminals or other prisoners were confined
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= action by which deities or humans inflict a penalty on other deities, humans, animals, or objects, usually as retribution for an offence
= process by which humans experience a strong emotion of shame

Node.gloss: to be ashamed|to come to shame|to be put to shame|to be disappointed
Node.definition: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status
literally: the hot one; hence: = the heavenly body from which the earth derives its light and warmth; ≈ associated with light and, by extension, with happiness

Node.gloss: to reign|to be king|to be queen|to become king|to become queen
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities are in a position of royal authority over a group of people
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom

= a council or a group of older men who act with authority on behalf of or over their people; some represent an entire nation, others manage the affairs at the town level; some provide their leader with counsel; involved in both judicial and military decisions, and participating in cultic ceremonies; ≈ expected to be wise and considered worthy of deference and respect
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
